snippet: The defeat of insurgents in an embattled city set the stage for elite soldiers to turn to other redoubts of Syria’s uprising, as international demands for a cease-fire intensify.
abstract: Syrian Army overwhelms the main rebel stronghold in the embattled city of Homs, setting the stage for its elite soldiers to turn their attention, and superior firepower, to other insurgent redoubts farther north, despite the increasing international pressure for a cease-fire and humanitarian access.

byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad and an employee of The New York Times contributed reporting from Beirut, and J. David Goodman from New York.

lead_paragraph: The defeat of insurgents in an embattled city set the stage for elite soldiers to turn to other redoubts of Syria’s uprising, as international demands for a cease-fire intensify.

headline.seo: Syrian Rebels Withdrawing From Key Enclave in Homs
headline.main: Syrian Forces Overwhelm Stronghold of Rebels in Homs
headline.print_headline: Syria Military Routs Rebels In Stronghold
